sentence.Network_en: He was disconsidered with his friends for his flippancy.
sentence.Network_cn: 他因言行轻浮而失去朋友的尊重.

sentence.Network_en: Not a fit time for flippancy.
They accused her of flippancy and subjectivity in her reporting of events in their country.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们指责她在报道他们国家的事件时轻率而主观。

list.abs: Not a fit time for flippancy ., 不是放肆的时候.

entry.tran: 轻率的;轻浮的;不严肃的
entry.def: If you describe a person or what they say as flippant, you are criticizing them because you think they are not taking something as seriously as they should.

example.ex: Don't be flippant, damn it! This is serious!...
example.tran: 该死，不要不当回事！这是很严肃的！

example.ex: He now dismisses that as a flippant comment.
example.tran: 他现在把那当作轻率的随口一说不再理会了。

auth_sentence.content: They are a combination of flippancy and insight; of jangly pop and full-throttle riffs.
auth_sentence.res_content: They are a combination of flippancy and insight; of jangly pop and full-throttle riffs.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They are a combination of flippancy and insight; of jangly pop and full-throttle riffs.

means.word_mean: 无礼的行动(或言语)；轻率的行动(或言语)
